question: I often generate multiple ideas when solving problems.
I enjoy exploring unconventional or unusual solutions.
I think systematically and can break down complex concepts easily.
I see patterns and connections before most people notice them.
I prefer doing things myself rather than planning endlessly.
I follow through on tasks even when I lose interest.
I can break down big tasks into actionable steps.
I can stay organised even under pressure.
I am comfortable taking bold decisions in uncertain situations.
I tend to avoid risky moves, even when the potential reward is high.
I recover quickly from setbacks.
I experiment with new approaches, even if failure is possible.
I am driven by a strong sense of purpose.
I keep going even when progress feels slow.
I feel energised by new goals and challenges.
I give up easily when problems pile up.
I enjoy building relationships with people.
I can collaborate effectively with diverse personalities.
I communicate ideas clearly to others.
I struggle to ask for help when needed.
I understand how ideas eventually become products or services.
I can identify customer needs before they are obvious.
I know how to assess if an idea has commercial potential.
I find it difficult to think about turning ideas into businesses.
I enjoy learning new frameworks or concepts to improve my ideas.

I stay calm and logical in uncertain situations.

I help others understand and contribute to shared goals.

I take time to reflect deeply before making decisions.
I often procrastinate even when I know what to do.

I tend to analyse situations too much before taking action.
I enjoy imagining future scenarios and possibilities.
